doc:
Winnie Lightner https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winnie_Lightner 0 Winnie Lightner (September 17, 1899 – March 5, 1971) was an American stage and motion picture actress. Perhaps best known as the gold-digging Mabel in Gold Diggers of Broadway (1929), Lightner was often typecast as a wise-cracking gold-digger and was known for her talents as a comedian and singer. She is also noted for introducing the song "Singin' in the Bathtub" in the 1929 motion picture The Show of Shows. Winnie_Lightner ( September_17_,_1899 – March_5_,_1971 ) was an_American_stage_and_motion_picture_actress . Perhaps best_known as the_gold-digging_Mabel in Gold_Diggers of Broadway_(_1929_) , Lightner was often_typecast as a_wise-cracking_gold-digger and was_known for her_talents as a_comedian_and_singer . She is_also_noted for introducing the_song " Singin ' in the_Bathtub " in the_1929_motion_picture The_Show of Shows .
